metadata.titleEn: HiWATER: Dataset of hydrometeorological observation network (No.5 runoff observation system of Ban bridge on the Heihe River, 2014)
metadata.titleCn: 黑河生态水文遥感试验：水文气象观测网数据集（5号点-板桥径流观测数据-2014）
metadata.description: The data set includes the observation data of river water level and velocity at NO.5 point in the dense runoff observation of the middle reaches of Heihe River from January 1 to April 30, 2014 and from July 18 to July 26, 2014,. The observation point is located in Heihe bridge, Banqiao Township, Linze County, Zhangye City, Gansu Province. The riverbed is sandy gravel with unstable section. The longitude and latitude of the observation point are n39 ° 15'32.41 ", E100 ° 16'33.95", with an altitude of 1398 meters and a channel width of 270 meters. In 2014, the water level was observed by sr50 ultrasonic distance meter with acquisition frequency of 30 minutes. During the observation period, the instrument failure was returned to the factory for maintenance, and the failure was not eliminated after later installation.
metadata.descriptionCn:
该数据集包含了2014年1月1日至4月30日，2014年7月18日至2014年7月26日的黑河中游径流加密观测中5号点的河流水位和流速观测数据，。观测点位于甘肃省张掖市临泽县板桥乡黑河桥，河床为砂砾石，断面不稳定。观测点的经纬度是N39°15'32.41"，E100°16'33.95"，海拔1398米，河道宽度270米。2014年水位观测采用SR50超声波测距仪观测，采集频率30分钟，观测期间仪器故障返厂维修，后期安装后故障并未排除。数据说明包括以下两部分：
水位观测，观测频率30分钟，单位（cm）；数据涵盖时间段2014年1月1日至2014年4月30日，2014年7月18日至2014年7月26日；流量观测，单位（m3）；按照不同水位监测流量，获取水位流量曲线，依托水位过程观测获得径流量变化过程。缺值数据统一采用字符串-6999表示。
水文气象网或站点信息请参考Li et al. (2013)，观测数据处理请参考He et al.(2016)。

background: Upscaling of eco-hydrological processes on a heterogeneous surface is a grand challenge. Progress in this field is hindered by the poor availability of multiscale observations. HiWATER is an experiment designed to address this challenge through instrumentation on hierarchically nested scales to obtain multiscale and multidisciplinary data.
challenges: Progress in this field is hindered by the poor availability of multiscale observations.
methods: Several intensive observation periods (IOPs) and continuous hydrometeorological observations were carried out during HiWATER. Only data collected during the IOP in 2012 are presented in this paper. Instruments for the oasis-desert system were arranged in hierarchically nested scales to capture multi-scale eco-hydrological processes. We established a sparse network to investigate the oasis-desert interaction. One superstation was constructed within the oasis, and four EC towers and four two-layer automatic meteorological stations (AMSs) were installed in different landscapes surrounding the oasis, including sandy desert, desert pavement, desert steppe, and wetland. Intensive observations were implemented at the irrigation district scale. A total of 12 airborne remote sensing missions were conducted to cover the FEA using LiDAR, an imaging spectrometer, a multi-angle thermal imager, and an L-band microwave radiometer.
dataset: We introduce a multiscale dataset obtained from Heihe Watershed Allied Telemetry Experimental Research (HiWATER) in an oasis-desert area in 2012. The HiWATER observation system consists of a flux observation matrix of eddy covariance towers, large aperture scintillometers, and automatic meteorological stations; an eco-hydrological sensor network of soil moisture and leaf area index; hyper-resolution airborne remote sensing using LiDAR, imaging spectrometer, multi-angle thermal imager, and L-band microwave radiometer; and synchronical ground measurements of vegetation dynamics and photosynthesis processes. All observational data were carefully quality controlled throughout sensor calibration, data collection, data processing, and datasets generation. The data are freely available at figshare and the Cold and Arid Regions Science Data Centre.
backgroundCn: 生态水文过程在异质表面上的上升尺度是一个重大挑战。该领域的进展受到多尺度观测稀缺的制约。HiWATER实验旨在通过在分层嵌套尺度上进行仪器布置，以获取多尺度和多学科的数据，从而应对这一挑战。
challengesCn: 该领域的进展受到多尺度观测稀缺的阻碍。
methodsCn: 在HiWATER期间进行了几次强化观测期（IOPs）和连续的水文气象观测。本文仅展示了2012年IOP期间收集的数据。为了捕捉多尺度生态水文过程，绿洲-沙漠系统的仪器按照层级嵌套的尺度进行布置。我们建立了一个稀疏网络，以研究绿洲-沙漠的相互作用。在绿洲内建造了一个超级站，并在绿洲周围不同的景观中安装了四个EC塔和四个双层自动气象站（AMS），这些景观包括沙漠、沙漠铺装、沙漠草原和湿地。在灌溉区尺度上实施了强化观测。共进行了12次空中遥感任务，使用了LiDAR、成像光谱仪、多角度热成像仪和L波段微波辐射计覆盖FEA。
datasetCn: 我们介绍了一个多尺度数据集，该数据集来自2012年在绿洲-沙漠地区进行的黑河流域联合遥测实验研究（HiWATER）。HiWATER观测系统由涡度协方差塔、大孔径闪烁仪和自动气象站组成的通量观测矩阵；土壤湿度和叶面积指数的生态水文传感器网络；使用激光雷达、成像光谱仪、多角度热成像仪和L波段微波辐射计的超高分辨率航空遥感；以及同步的植被动态和光合作用过程的地面测量。所有观测数据在传感器校准、数据收集、数据处理和数据集生成过程中都经过了严格的质量控制。这些数据可在figshare和寒区与干旱区科学数据中心免费获取。

background: Arid and semiarid regions represent approximately 30 % of the global terrestrial surface area (Dregne, 1991; Scanlon et al., 2006), and dryland expansion occurs under climate change, especially in developing countries (Huang et al., 2016). An oasis is a unique ecological landscape in arid and semi-arid areas that is not only the core of regions’ ecological environment but also the foundation of their economic development, especially in western China, which has been an important part of the “Silk Road” since ancient times. Oases comprising less than 10 % of the total area of arid regions support more than 90 % of the population in these regions of China (Chu et al., 2005; Li et al., 2016; Zhou et al., 2022). The oasis–desert system plays a crucial role in maintaining a stable ecological environment and agricultural productivity (Zhang and Zhao, 2015). Extensive studies have investigated energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert areas based on field and remote-sensing observations (Taha et al., 1991; Potchter et al., 2008; Xue et al., 2019; Wang et al., 2019; Zhou et al., 2022) and numerical simulations (Chu et al., 2005; Meng et al., 2009; Georgescu et al., 2011; Liu et al., 2020). In addition, oasis–desert areas located in semiarid regions have been found to be carbon sinks by previous researchers (Tagesson et al., 2016; Wang et al., 2019); thus, they can significantly affect the carbon balance of arid regions and play an increasingly important role within the global carbon cycle.
research objective: Therefore, it is critical to maintain the balance between oasis and desert systems in order to achieve the goal of sustainable oasis development. Understanding the basic characteristics of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert ecosystems is important to achieve the goals of carbon peaking and carbon neutrality in the oasis–desert area and support the ecological security and sustainable development of the oasis. A quantitative understanding of the energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert areas is crucial to recognize the oasis–desert interactions and is significant to protect the ecological stability and socioeconomic development of oases; moreover, long-term observations are indispensable.
challenges: Inland river basins in arid and semiarid areas are facing the crisis of ecological environment degradation, such as the drying up of rivers and lakes, the degradation of natural vegetation, the intensification of land desertification, and the frequent occurrence of dust storms, especially in many inland river basins westward along the Silk Road, such as the Tarim River basin (Zhao et al., 2013), the Aral Sea basin (Stanev et al., 2004; Crétaux et al., 2009), and the Lake Urmia basin (Stone, 2015).
methods: In this study, we present a suite of observational datasets from artificial and natural oasis–desert systems that consist of long-term energy, water vapor, carbon and methane fluxes as well as auxiliary data involving hydrometeorology, vegetation, and soil parameters from 2012 to 2021. Half-hourly turbulent flux data were acquired by an eddy covariance system and scintillometer. The hydrometeorological data (including radiation, soil heat flux, and soil temperature profiles; gradients of air temperature and humidity and of wind speed and direction; and air pressure, precipitation, and soil moisture profiles) were observed from automatic weather stations with a 10 min average period as well as the groundwater table data. Moreover, vegetation and soil parameters were also supplemented in the datasets. The data processing and quality control procedure can be divided into data collection, data processing, and data archiving and sharing.
dataset: The study area comprises the middle and lower reaches of the HRB, located in the arid regions of western China, that receive water from the typical cryosphere of the upper reaches. A total of 11 land surface flux and meteorological stations have been established in these regions since 2012 – 2 superstations and 9 ordinary stations. The dataset of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange observations in oasis–desert areas reported in this study (including energy, water vapor, and carbon fluxes; hydrometeorological data; and vegetation and soil parameters) is freely available from the National Tibetan Plateau Data Center.
backgroundCn: 干旱和半干旱地区约占全球陆地表面积的30%（Dregne, 1991；Scanlon et al., 2006），在气候变化的影响下，干旱地区的扩展尤其发生在发展中国家（Huang et al., 2016）。绿洲是干旱和半干旱地区独特的生态景观，不仅是这些地区生态环境的核心，也是其经济发展的基础，特别是在中国西部，自古以来就一直是“丝绸之路”的重要组成部分。绿洲占干旱地区总面积的不到10%，却支持着中国这些地区90%以上的人口（Chu et al., 2005；Li et al., 2016；Zhou et al., 2022）。绿洲-沙漠系统在维持稳定的生态环境和农业生产力方面发挥着至关重要的作用（Zhang and Zhao, 2015）。大量研究基于实地和遥感观测（Taha et al., 1991；Potchter et al., 2008；Xue et al., 2019；Wang et al., 2019；Zhou et al., 2022）以及数值模拟（Chu et al., 2005；Meng et al., 2009；Georgescu et al., 2011；Liu et al., 2020）对绿洲-沙漠地区的能量、水汽和碳交换进行了广泛研究。此外，先前的研究发现，位于半干旱地区的绿洲-沙漠区域是碳汇（Tagesson et al., 2016；Wang et al., 2019）；因此，它们可以显著影响干旱地区的碳平衡，并在全球碳循环中发挥越来越重要的作用。
research objectiveCn: 因此，维持绿洲与沙漠系统之间的平衡对于实现可持续绿洲发展的目标至关重要。了解绿洲-沙漠生态系统中能量、水汽和碳交换的基本特征，对于实现绿洲-沙漠地区的碳达峰和碳中和目标，以及支持绿洲的生态安全和可持续发展是非常重要的。对绿洲-沙漠地区能量、水汽和碳交换的定量理解，对于认识绿洲-沙漠之间的相互作用至关重要，并且对保护绿洲的生态稳定性和社会经济发展具有重要意义；此外，长期观测是不可或缺的。
challengesCn: 内陆河流流域在干旱和半干旱地区面临生态环境退化的危机，例如河流和湖泊干涸、自然植被退化、土地沙漠化加剧以及沙尘暴频发，尤其是在丝绸之路沿线的许多内陆河流流域，如塔里木河流域（赵等，2013）、咸海流域（Stanev等，2004；Crétaux等，2009）和乌尔米湖流域（Stone，2015）。
methodsCn: 在本研究中，我们展示了一套来自人工和自然绿洲–沙漠系统的观测数据集，涵盖了2012年至2021年的长期能量、水蒸气、碳和甲烷通量，以及涉及水文气象、植被和土壤参数的辅助数据。半小时的湍流通量数据是通过涡度协方差系统和闪烁仪获取的。水文气象数据（包括辐射、土壤热通量和土壤温度剖面；空气温度和湿度的梯度，以及风速和风向的梯度；空气压力、降水和土壤湿度剖面）是通过自动气象站以10分钟的平均周期观测的，同时也记录了地下水位数据。此外，数据集中还补充了植被和土壤参数。数据处理和质量控制程序可以分为数据收集、数据处理和数据归档与共享。
datasetCn: 研究区域包括位于中国西部干旱地区的HRB中下游，水源来自上游典型的冰冻圈。自2012年以来，在这些地区建立了11个地表通量和气象站，包括2个超级站和9个普通站。本研究报告的绿洲-沙漠地区能量、水汽和碳交换观测数据集（包括能量、水汽和碳通量；水文气象数据；以及植被和土壤参数）可从国家西藏高原数据中心免费获取。

Disjunctive.QuestionEn: Which type of data is more challenging to collect in oasis-desert systems: multiscale observations, long-term hydrometeorological data, or vegetation dynamics?
Disjunctive.QuestionCn: 在绿洲-沙漠系统中，收集哪种类型的数据更具挑战性：多尺度观测、长期水文气象数据还是植被动态？

Concept Completion.AnswerCn: 黑河流域的中下游地区

Example.QuestionEn: Can you provide an example of a data collection method used to capture multiscale eco-hydrological processes in oasis-desert systems?
Example.QuestionCn: 您能否提供一个用于捕捉绿洲-沙漠系统中多尺度生态水文过程的数据收集方法的示例？
Example.AnswerEn: Several intensive observation periods (IOPs) and continuous hydrometeorological observations were carried out using instruments arranged in hierarchically nested scales, including eddy covariance towers, large aperture scintillometers, and automatic meteorological stations.
Example.AnswerCn: 进行了多个强烈观测期（IOPs）和连续的水文气象观测，使用了按层次嵌套的仪器，包括涡度协方差塔、大孔径闪烁仪和自动气象站。

Example.QuestionEn: What is an example of a challenge faced when collecting data on energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert ecosystems?
Example.QuestionCn: 在收集关于绿洲-沙漠生态系统中能量、水蒸气和碳交换的数据时，面临的一个挑战是什么？
Example.AnswerEn: A significant challenge is the crisis of ecological environment degradation in inland river basins, such as drying rivers and lakes, degradation of natural vegetation, and frequent dust storms, which complicate data collection efforts.
Example.AnswerCn: 一个重大挑战是内陆河流域生态环境退化的危机，例如河流和湖泊干涸、自然植被退化以及频繁的沙尘暴，这使得数据收集工作变得更加复杂。

Example.QuestionEn: Provide an example of a dataset that includes long-term observations of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in arid regions.
Example.QuestionCn: 提供一个包含干旱地区能源、水汽和碳交换的长期观测数据集的示例。
Example.AnswerEn: A dataset from the middle and lower reaches of the HRB, covering observations from 2012 to 2021, includes long-term data on energy, water vapor, carbon and methane fluxes, and auxiliary data involving hydrometeorology, vegetation, and soil parameters.
Example.AnswerCn: 一个来自HRB中下游的数据库，涵盖2012年至2021年的观测数据，包括能源、水汽、碳和甲烷通量的长期数据，以及涉及水文气象、植被和土壤参数的辅助数据。

Feature Specification.QuestionEn: What specific attributes are measured by the eco-hydrological sensor network in oasis-desert systems?
Feature Specification.QuestionCn: 在绿洲-沙漠系统中，生态水文传感器网络测量的具体属性包括：
Feature Specification.AnswerEn: soil moisture, leaf area index, vegetation dynamics, photosynthesis processes
Feature Specification.AnswerCn: 土壤湿度、叶面积指数、植被动态、光合作用过程

Feature Specification.QuestionEn: What are the main challenges in obtaining multiscale observations in eco-hydrological processes?
Feature Specification.QuestionCn: 在获取生态水文过程的多尺度观测时，主要面临哪些挑战？
Feature Specification.AnswerEn: poor availability of observations, need for hierarchically nested instrumentation
Feature Specification.AnswerCn: 观测数据可用性差，需要分层嵌套的仪器。

Quantification.QuestionEn: What is the frequency of data collection for river water level observations at the specified site in the Heihe Watershed?
Quantification.QuestionCn: 在黑河流域指定地点的河流水位观测数据收集频率是多少？

Quantification.QuestionEn: How many airborne remote sensing missions were conducted to cover the FEA using various instruments during the HiWATER experiment?
Quantification.QuestionCn: 在HiWATER实验期间，进行了多少次空中遥感任务，以各种仪器覆盖FEA？

Quantification.QuestionEn: How many land surface flux and meteorological stations have been established in the middle and lower reaches of the Heihe River Basin since 2012?
Quantification.QuestionCn: 自2012年以来，在黑河流域中下游地区建立了多少个地表通量和气象站？

Definition.QuestionEn: What does 'hierarchically nested scales' mean in the context of eco-hydrological observations?
Definition.QuestionCn: 在生态水文观测的背景下，“层次嵌套尺度”指的是不同层次或尺度的观测数据相互嵌套和关联的方式。这意味着在生态水文研究中，观测可以在多个空间和时间尺度上进行，这些尺度之间存在层次关系，能够更好地理解生态系统的复杂性和水文过程的相互作用。
Definition.AnswerEn: 'Hierarchically nested scales' in eco-hydrological observations refer to the arrangement of observational instruments and methods in a structured manner that allows for capturing data at multiple spatial and temporal scales, thereby facilitating a detailed analysis of eco-hydrological processes across different levels of granularity.
Definition.AnswerCn: “层次嵌套尺度”在生态水文观测中指的是观测仪器和方法的结构化安排，能够在多个空间和时间尺度上捕获数据，从而促进对不同粒度水平的生态水文过程的详细分析。

Definition.QuestionEn: What is meant by 'quality control' in the context of eco-hydrological data collection?
Definition.QuestionCn: 在生态水文数据收集的背景下，“质量控制”是指确保收集的数据准确、可靠和一致的过程。这包括对数据收集方法、设备和结果进行监测和评估，以识别和纠正潜在的错误或偏差，从而提高数据的整体质量和有效性。
Definition.AnswerEn: In the context of eco-hydrological data collection, 'quality control' involves a series of procedures to ensure the accuracy and reliability of the data, including sensor calibration, systematic data collection, careful data processing, and the generation of datasets that are free from errors and biases.
Definition.AnswerCn: 在生态水文数据收集的背景下，“质量控制”涉及一系列程序，以确保数据的准确性和可靠性，包括传感器校准、系统的数据收集、仔细的数据处理，以及生成无错误和偏差的数据集。

Comparison.QuestionEn: How do the data collection methods for water level and flow velocity observations in the Heihe River Basin compare to the methods used for energy, water vapor, and carbon flux measurements in oasis-desert systems?
Comparison.QuestionCn: 在黑河流域的水位和流速观测的数据收集方法与在绿洲-沙漠系统中用于能量、水蒸气和碳通量测量的方法相比，如何？
Comparison.AnswerEn: The water level and flow velocity observations in the Heihe River Basin utilize SR50 ultrasonic rangefinders with a 30-minute frequency, while energy, water vapor, and carbon flux measurements in oasis-desert systems use eddy covariance systems, scintillometers, and automatic meteorological stations. The latter involves a broader set of instruments and parameters, including turbulent flux data, radiation, soil heat flux, and gradients of air temperature and humidity.
Comparison.AnswerCn: 在黑河流域，水位和流速观测使用SR50超声波测距仪，频率为30分钟，而在绿洲-沙漠系统中，能量、水汽和碳通量的测量则使用涡度协方差系统、闪烁仪和自动气象站。后者涉及更广泛的仪器和参数，包括湍流通量数据、辐射、土壤热通量以及空气温度和湿度的梯度。

Comparison.QuestionEn: In what ways do the challenges faced in obtaining multiscale observations in eco-hydrological processes differ from those encountered in long-term energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange data collection in arid and semiarid regions?
Comparison.QuestionCn: 在获取生态水文过程的多尺度观测时所面临的挑战与在干旱和半干旱地区收集长期能量、水蒸气和碳交换数据时所遇到的挑战有何不同？
Comparison.AnswerEn: The challenge in obtaining multiscale observations for eco-hydrological processes primarily relates to the poor availability of multiscale observations due to heterogeneous surfaces. In contrast, long-term energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange data collection in arid and semiarid regions is challenged by ecological degradation, including drying rivers, vegetation degradation, and desertification. Both fields face logistical and environmental challenges but differ in their primary focus areas.
Comparison.AnswerCn: 获取生态水文过程的多尺度观测的挑战主要与由于表面异质性导致的多尺度观测的稀缺性有关。相比之下，在干旱和半干旱地区，长期的能量、水蒸气和碳交换数据收集受到生态退化的挑战，包括河流干涸、植被退化和沙漠化。这两个领域都面临后勤和环境挑战，但在其主要关注领域上有所不同。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: How might the presence of oasis-desert interactions influence the interpretation of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange data collected from arid regions?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 绿洲-沙漠相互作用的存在如何影响从干旱地区收集的能量、水汽和碳交换数据的解读？
Interpretation.AnswerEn: Oasis-desert interactions can significantly influence the interpretation of data on energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange by introducing spatial heterogeneity and temporal variability into the data. These interactions can create microclimatic conditions that affect energy balance, water availability, and carbon dynamics. Understanding these interactions requires detailed multiscale observations and modeling efforts to accurately represent the unique ecological processes occurring at the interface of oasis and desert environments.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 绿洲与沙漠的相互作用可以显著影响对能量、水汽和碳交换数据的解释，因为它们引入了空间异质性和时间变异性。这些相互作用可以创造微气候条件，影响能量平衡、水资源可用性和碳动态。理解这些相互作用需要详细的多尺度观测和建模工作，以准确表示绿洲与沙漠环境交界处发生的独特生态过程。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: What considerations should be made when designing a dataset that aims to support long-term observations of hydrometeorological parameters in arid inland river basins?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 在设计一个旨在支持干旱内陆河流流域水文气象参数长期观测的数据集时，应考虑以下因素：
Interpretation.AnswerEn: Designing a dataset for long-term hydrometeorological observations in arid inland river basins should consider factors such as the selection of appropriate sensor networks to capture diverse parameters like radiation, soil moisture, and flux measurements. It should also include strategies for data quality control, calibration, and integration across different temporal and spatial scales. Additionally, addressing challenges such as equipment maintenance, data continuity, and variability in environmental conditions is crucial for ensuring the dataset's reliability and usefulness for long-term ecological and climatic studies.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 设计一个用于干旱内陆河流流域的长期水文气象观测数据集时，应考虑多个因素，例如选择合适的传感器网络以捕捉辐射、土壤湿度和通量测量等多种参数。数据集还应包括数据质量控制、校准以及在不同时间和空间尺度上的集成策略。此外，解决设备维护、数据连续性和环境条件变化等挑战对于确保数据集的可靠性和在长期生态与气候研究中的实用性至关重要。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What factors contribute to the challenges of obtaining multiscale observations in eco-hydrological studies?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 在生态水文研究中，获取多尺度观测的挑战因素包括哪些？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: Progress in capturing multiscale observations is hindered by the poor availability of such observations, which is a challenge addressed by experiments like HiWATER through hierarchically nested instrumentation to obtain diverse and interdisciplinary data.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 多尺度观测的捕获进展受到此类观测稀缺的限制，这一挑战通过像HiWATER这样的实验得以解决，该实验采用分层嵌套的仪器以获取多样化和跨学科的数据。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: Why is it critical to maintain the balance between oasis and desert systems in arid and semi-arid regions?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 在干旱和半干旱地区，维持绿洲与沙漠系统之间的平衡至关重要。
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: Maintaining the balance between oasis and desert systems is crucial for achieving sustainable oasis development, supporting ecological stability, socioeconomic development, and achieving the goals of carbon peaking and carbon neutrality.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 维持绿洲与沙漠系统之间的平衡对于实现可持续的绿洲发展、支持生态稳定、促进社会经济发展以及实现碳达峰和碳中和目标至关重要。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What causes the degradation of ecological environments in inland river basins of arid and semi-arid areas?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 导致干旱和半干旱地区内陆河流流域生态环境退化的原因是什么？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: Inland river basins in these regions face ecological degradation due to factors like drying rivers and lakes, natural vegetation degradation, intensified land desertification, and frequent dust storms.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 内陆河流流域面临生态退化，原因包括河流和湖泊干涸、自然植被退化、土地沙漠化加剧以及频繁的沙尘暴。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: What are the potential consequences of utilizing hierarchically nested scales in eco-hydrological data collection methods on the understanding of oasis-desert interactions?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 利用分层嵌套尺度的生态水文数据收集方法对绿洲-沙漠相互作用理解的潜在后果是什么？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: Utilizing hierarchically nested scales in eco-hydrological data collection methods allows for a comprehensive understanding of multi-scale processes and interactions in the oasis-desert system, potentially leading to improved insights into energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange dynamics. This approach can help address the challenge of poor availability of multiscale observations and contribute to sustainable oasis development.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 利用分层嵌套尺度的生态水文数据收集方法，可以全面理解绿洲-沙漠系统中的多尺度过程和相互作用，可能会改善对能量、水汽和碳交换动态的洞察。这种方法可以帮助解决多尺度观测稀缺的问题，并有助于可持续的绿洲发展。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: What outcomes might arise from implementing a multiscale dataset that includes both remote sensing and ground measurements in studying oasis-desert systems?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 实施一个包含遥感和地面测量的多尺度数据集来研究绿洲-沙漠系统可能会产生哪些结果？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: Implementing a multiscale dataset that combines remote sensing and ground measurements can result in a more robust analysis of the eco-hydrological processes in oasis-desert systems. It enhances the ability to capture the dynamics of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchanges, thereby providing critical data for understanding the ecological balance and informing sustainable management strategies.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 实施一个结合遥感和地面测量的多尺度数据集，可以更全面地分析绿洲-沙漠系统中的生态水文过程。它增强了捕捉能量、水蒸气和碳交换动态的能力，从而为理解生态平衡提供了关键数据，并为可持续管理策略提供了信息。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: How might the extensive use of eddy covariance systems and automatic meteorological stations impact the quality and breadth of data collected in arid and semiarid regions' oasis-desert systems?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 广泛使用涡度协方差系统和自动气象站将如何影响在干旱和半干旱地区绿洲-沙漠系统中收集的数据的质量和广度？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: The extensive use of eddy covariance systems and automatic meteorological stations can significantly improve the quality and breadth of data collected by providing continuous, high-resolution measurements of turbulent fluxes and hydrometeorological parameters. This leads to a better understanding of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchanges in oasis-desert systems, which is essential for ecological security and sustainable development.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 广泛使用涡度协方差系统和自动气象站可以显著提高数据收集的质量和广度，通过提供连续的高分辨率湍流通量和水气象参数的测量。这有助于更好地理解绿洲-沙漠系统中的能量、水蒸气和碳交换，这对生态安全和可持续发展至关重要。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: What are the objectives behind establishing a hydrometeorological observation network in an oasis-desert area using instruments on hierarchically nested scales?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 在绿洲-沙漠地区建立水文气象观测网络的目标是什么，使用分层嵌套尺度的仪器？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: The goal is to address the challenge of upscaling eco-hydrological processes on a heterogeneous surface by obtaining multiscale and multidisciplinary data, which is hindered by the poor availability of multiscale observations.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 目标是通过获取多尺度和多学科的数据来解决在异质表面上提升生态水文过程的挑战，而这受到多尺度观测稀缺的限制。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: Why is it important to maintain a balance between oasis and desert systems for sustainable development?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 保持绿洲和沙漠系统之间的平衡对于可持续发展至关重要。
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: Maintaining this balance is crucial to achieve sustainable oasis development, understand the energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert ecosystems, and support the ecological security and socioeconomic development of the oasis.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 维持这种平衡对于实现可持续的绿洲发展、理解绿洲-沙漠生态系统中的能量、水汽和碳交换，以及支持绿洲的生态安全和社会经济发展至关重要。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: What is the significance of obtaining long-term observations of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis-desert ecosystems?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 获得绿洲-沙漠生态系统中能量、水蒸气和碳交换的长期观测具有重要意义。
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: Long-term observations are indispensable for recognizing oasis–desert interactions, protecting ecological stability, achieving carbon peaking and carbon neutrality, and supporting sustainable development in these regions.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 长期观察对于识别绿洲与沙漠之间的相互作用、保护生态稳定、实现碳达峰和碳中和以及支持这些地区的可持续发展至关重要。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: How are multiscale eco-hydrological processes captured using instrumentation in oasis-desert systems?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 如何通过仪器捕捉绿洲-沙漠系统中的多尺度生态水文过程？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: Instruments for the oasis-desert system are arranged in hierarchically nested scales to capture multi-scale eco-hydrological processes. This includes a sparse network to investigate the oasis-desert interaction, with one superstation constructed within the oasis, and four EC towers and four two-layer automatic meteorological stations installed in different landscapes surrounding the oasis.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 用于绿洲-沙漠系统的仪器按照层次嵌套的尺度进行排列，以捕捉多尺度的生态水文过程。这包括一个稀疏的网络，用于研究绿洲与沙漠之间的相互作用，在绿洲内建造了一个超级站，并在绿洲周围的不同景观中安装了四个EC塔和四个双层自动气象站。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What procedures are involved in the quality control and processing of eco-hydrological data collected from the Heihe Watershed Allied Telemetry Experimental Research?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 在黑河流域联合遥测实验研究中，生态水文数据的质量控制和处理涉及哪些程序？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: All observational data are carefully quality controlled through sensor calibration, data collection, data processing, and datasets generation. The data processing and quality control procedure can be divided into data collection, data processing, and data archiving and sharing.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 所有观测数据都经过精心的质量控制，包括传感器校准、数据收集、数据处理和数据集生成。数据处理和质量控制程序可以分为数据收集、数据处理和数据归档与共享。

Enablement.QuestionEn: What instrumentation and hierarchical structuring enable the capture of multiscale eco-hydrological processes in heterogeneous surfaces?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 什么样的仪器和层次结构能够捕捉异质表面中的多尺度生态水文过程？
Enablement.AnswerEn: The HiWATER experiment employs instrumentation on hierarchically nested scales, including a flux observation matrix of eddy covariance towers, large aperture scintillometers, automatic meteorological stations, an eco-hydrological sensor network, and hyper-resolution airborne remote sensing to capture multiscale eco-hydrological processes.
Enablement.AnswerCn: HiWATER实验采用分层嵌套尺度的仪器，包括涡度协方差塔的通量观测矩阵、大孔径闪烁仪、自动气象站、生态水文传感器网络和超高分辨率航空遥感，以捕捉多尺度生态水文过程。

Enablement.QuestionEn: How does the arrangement of meteorological stations and eddy covariance systems contribute to understanding energy and carbon fluxes in oasis-desert ecosystems?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 气象站和涡度协方差系统的布置如何有助于理解绿洲-沙漠生态系统中的能量和碳通量。
Enablement.AnswerEn: The arrangement of meteorological stations and eddy covariance systems, including a sparse network and superstations, facilitates the acquisition of long-term energy, water vapor, and carbon fluxes, enabling a quantitative understanding of oasis–desert interactions and supporting ecological stability and socioeconomic development of oases.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 气象站和涡度协方差系统的布置，包括稀疏网络和超级站，促进了长期能量、水蒸气和碳通量的获取，使我们能够定量理解绿洲与沙漠之间的相互作用，并支持绿洲的生态稳定和社会经济发展。

Enablement.QuestionEn: What data processing and quality control measures are essential for generating reliable datasets in eco-hydrological research?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 在生态水文学研究中，生成可靠数据集所需的关键数据处理和质量控制措施有哪些？
Enablement.AnswerEn: Data processing and quality control measures include sensor calibration, data collection, data processing, and archiving and sharing, which are essential for ensuring the reliability and accuracy of datasets in eco-hydrological research, as demonstrated in the HiWATER experiment.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 数据处理和质量控制措施包括传感器校准、数据收集、数据处理以及归档和共享，这些对于确保生态水文研究中数据集的可靠性和准确性至关重要，正如HiWATER实验所示。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why is the availability of multiscale observations considered a challenge in capturing eco-hydrological processes?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 多尺度观测的可用性被认为是捕捉生态水文过程的一大挑战。
Expectation.AnswerEn: Progress in understanding eco-hydrological processes is hindered by the poor availability of multiscale observations. The HiWATER experiment addresses this challenge by using instrumentation on hierarchically nested scales to obtain multiscale and multidisciplinary data.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 对生态水文过程的理解进展受到多尺度观测数据稀缺的制约。HiWATER实验通过在分层嵌套的尺度上使用仪器，获取多尺度和多学科的数据，以应对这一挑战。

Expectation.QuestionEn: What are some anticipated outcomes of using a multiscale dataset in oasis-desert areas for understanding ecosystem interactions?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 使用多尺度数据集在绿洲-沙漠地区理解生态系统相互作用的预期结果有哪些？
Expectation.AnswerEn: A multiscale dataset obtained from Heihe Watershed Allied Telemetry Experimental Research (HiWATER) in an oasis-desert area provides insights into energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange. This quantitative understanding is crucial for recognizing oasis-desert interactions and supporting ecological stability and socioeconomic development.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 从黑河流域联合遥感实验研究（HiWATER）获得的多尺度数据集提供了关于能量、水蒸气和碳交换的洞察。这种定量理解对于认识绿洲-沙漠相互作用以及支持生态稳定和社会经济发展至关重要。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why might long-term observations be indispensable in studying oasis-desert ecosystems in arid regions?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 长期观察在研究干旱地区的绿洲-沙漠生态系统中可能是不可或缺的，原因是什么？
Expectation.AnswerEn: Long-term observations are indispensable because they provide a quantitative understanding of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis-desert ecosystems, which is crucial for achieving the goals of carbon peaking, carbon neutrality, and supporting the ecological security and sustainable development of the oasis.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 长期观测是不可或缺的，因为它们提供了对绿洲-沙漠生态系统中能量、水汽和碳交换的定量理解，这对于实现碳达峰、碳中和的目标以及支持绿洲的生态安全和可持续发展至关重要。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: How could the methodological rigor of data collection techniques in eco-hydrological observations be assessed in terms of scalability and multiscale observation challenges?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 如何评估生态水文观测中数据收集技术的方法论严谨性，以应对可扩展性和多尺度观测挑战？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: The methodological rigor in eco-hydrological observations can be assessed by examining how well the data collection techniques address the challenges of scalability and multiscale observations. The HiWATER experiment, for instance, addresses these challenges by using hierarchically nested scales and a combination of intensive observation periods and continuous hydrometeorological observations. This approach allows for capturing multi-scale eco-hydrological processes, which is crucial for upscaling processes on heterogeneous surfaces.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 生态水文观测中的方法论严谨性可以通过检查数据收集技术如何应对可扩展性和多尺度观测的挑战来评估。例如，HiWATER实验通过使用分层嵌套尺度以及结合强烈观测期和连续的水文气象观测来应对这些挑战。这种方法能够捕捉多尺度的生态水文过程，这对于在异质表面上进行过程的上尺度化至关重要。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: Given the complex nature of oasis–desert interactions, how might researchers improve the scope and applicability of datasets to better support sustainable development goals in these regions?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 鉴于绿洲与沙漠之间相互作用的复杂性，研究人员如何改善数据集的范围和适用性，以更好地支持这些地区的可持续发展目标？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: To improve the scope and applicability of datasets for supporting sustainable development in oasis–desert regions, researchers could focus on expanding the range of variables monitored, such as energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange, and integrating these with socio-economic data. Implementing advanced sensor networks and remote sensing technologies, such as LiDAR and imaging spectrometers, can enhance the spatial and temporal resolution of datasets. Additionally, fostering data sharing and collaboration among research institutions can facilitate a more comprehensive understanding of oasis–desert interactions.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 为了提高支持绿洲-沙漠地区可持续发展的数据集的范围和适用性，研究人员可以专注于扩展监测的变量范围，例如能量、水蒸气和碳交换，并将这些数据与社会经济数据整合。实施先进的传感器网络和遥感技术，如激光雷达和成像光谱仪，可以增强数据集的空间和时间分辨率。此外，促进研究机构之间的数据共享与合作，可以帮助更全面地理解绿洲-沙漠之间的相互作用。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I don’t understand how multiscale observations can be effectively organized to address eco-hydrological challenges in arid regions.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我不明白如何有效地组织多尺度观测以应对干旱地区的生态水文挑战。
Assertion.AnswerEn: A multiscale dataset obtained from Heihe Watershed Allied Telemetry Experimental Research (HiWATER) uses instrumentation on hierarchically nested scales, including a flux observation matrix, eco-hydrological sensor networks, and hyper-resolution airborne remote sensing, to capture multi-scale eco-hydrological processes.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 从黑河流域联合遥测实验研究（HiWATER）获得的多尺度数据集使用分层嵌套尺度的仪器，包括通量观测矩阵、生态水文传感器网络和超高分辨率航空遥感，以捕捉多尺度生态水文过程。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I’m unsure about the methods used to maintain data quality across long-term observations in oasis–desert ecosystems.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我对在绿洲-沙漠生态系统中维持长期观察数据质量的方法感到不确定。
Assertion.AnswerEn: The data processing and quality control procedures involve sensor calibration, data collection, data processing, and datasets generation, ensuring high-quality data across long-term observations of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert ecosystems.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 数据处理和质量控制程序包括传感器校准、数据收集、数据处理和数据集生成，确保在绿洲-沙漠生态系统的长期观测中获得高质量的数据，涵盖能量、水蒸气和碳交换。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I don't understand how data collection techniques account for the variability in river flow and water levels in an unstable riverbed.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我不明白数据收集技术如何考虑不稳定河床中河流流量和水位的变异性。
Assertion.AnswerEn: In the 黑河生态水文遥感试验, water level and flow rate data were collected using SR50 ultrasonic distance meters with a 30-minute observation frequency, and flow rate was monitored at different water levels to obtain a water level-flow curve, despite challenges with instrument maintenance.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 在黑河生态水文遥感试验中，使用SR50超声波测距仪以30分钟的观测频率收集水位和流量数据，并在不同水位下监测流量，以获得水位-流量曲线，尽管在仪器维护方面面临挑战。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please explore and summarize the methodologies used to capture multiscale eco-hydrological processes in oasis-desert systems.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 请探讨并总结在绿洲-沙漠系统中捕捉多尺度生态水文过程的方法论。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: The methodologies used include instrumentation on hierarchically nested scales with eddy covariance towers, large aperture scintillometers, and automatic meteorological stations. Intensive observations at the irrigation district scale and hyper-resolution airborne remote sensing with LiDAR, an imaging spectrometer, a multi-angle thermal imager, and an L-band microwave radiometer were conducted. A sparse network was established to investigate oasis-desert interactions, and various stations were installed in different landscapes.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 所使用的方法包括在层次嵌套尺度上进行仪器测量，使用涡度协方差塔、大孔径闪烁仪和自动气象站。在灌溉区规模上进行了密集观测，并使用激光雷达、成像光谱仪、多角度热成像仪和L波段微波辐射计进行了超高分辨率的空中遥感。建立了一个稀疏网络以研究绿洲-沙漠相互作用，并在不同的景观中安装了各种站点。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please analyze the challenges faced in collecting multiscale observations for eco-hydrological processes and suggest potential solutions.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 分析在收集生态水文过程的多尺度观测时面临的挑战，并提出潜在的解决方案。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: The main challenge is the poor availability of multiscale observations, which hinders progress. Potential solutions include implementing a more comprehensive observation system with hierarchically nested instrumentation and establishing networks that investigate interactions at multiple scales. Additionally, ensuring quality control throughout sensor calibration, data collection, and data processing is crucial.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 主要挑战是多尺度观测的可用性差，这阻碍了进展。潜在的解决方案包括实施更全面的观测系统，配备分层嵌套的仪器，以及建立调查多个尺度相互作用的网络。此外，确保在传感器校准、数据收集和数据处理过程中进行质量控制也至关重要。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please identify potential datasets available for studying energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis-desert ecosystems and describe their data collection methods.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 请识别可用于研究绿洲-沙漠生态系统中能量、水蒸气和碳交换的潜在数据集，并描述它们的数据收集方法。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: Potential datasets include those obtained from long-term energy, water vapor, carbon, and methane fluxes, as well as auxiliary hydrometeorological, vegetation, and soil parameters collected from automatic weather stations and eddy covariance systems. The data collection methods involve half-hourly turbulent flux data collection, 10-minute average period hydrometeorological observations, and the inclusion of vegetation and soil parameters in the datasets.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 潜在的数据集包括从长期能源、水蒸气、碳和甲烷通量中获得的数据，以及从自动气象站和涡度协方差系统收集的辅助水文气象、植被和土壤参数。数据收集方法涉及每半小时收集一次湍流通量数据、每10分钟平均一次的水文气象观测，以及将植被和土壤参数纳入数据集中。
